definition: far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)

sentences.english: The previously known most distant object was a short-lived gamma ray burst.
sentences.chinese: 之前所知最遙遠的天體是一次短期的伽瑪射線暴。

sentences.english: The petrel came winnowing in from afar on the sea.
sentences.chinese: 海燕從海上遙遠的地方振翅飛來。

sentences.english: I am lured by faraway distances, the immense void I project upon the world.
sentences.chinese: 我被遙遠的地方所吸引，我把巨大的空虛拋向世界。

sentences.english: What you said is abit too far!
In distant Jerusalem, wicked Herod was still king.
sentences.chinese: 在遙遠的耶路撒冷，缺德的希律王仍然是國王。

sentences.english: My goal against Modena is now a distant memory.
sentences.chinese: 我對莫德納的進球已經是太過遙遠的記憶了。

sentences.english: That small town is the last far-flung outpost of our country.
sentences.chinese: 那個小城鎮是我們國家一個遙遠的前哨基地。

sentences.english: While the Empire sought to exert control over distant worlds, C'baoth was content to rule over Wayland.
sentences.chinese: 帝國尋求控制遙遠的世界，而瑟鮑思滿足於統治韋蘭。

sentences.english: If heaven is a million years away, oh just call me and I make your day.
sentences.chinese: 縱使路途遙遠千年萬年，我也必定將你帶入那片天堂。

sentences.english: The faint greenish disk of distant planet Uranus is near the upper left corner.
sentences.chinese: 在圖片的左上角淡淡發綠的是遙遠的天王星的軌道面。

sentences.english: However, when it comes to her future, Jike definitely has longer distances on her mind.
sentences.chinese: 可是當談到她的未來時，似乎離她很遙遠。

sentences.english: But when he was at sea he could seem distant.
sentences.chinese: 但是當他在海上航行時似乎就很是遙遠了。

sentences.english: In the distant ancient Greece, there was a beautiful legend.
sentences.chinese: 在遙遠的希臘古國，有一個美麗動人的傳說。

sentences.english: In the distant targets at the same time, don't think slightingly of the nearby.
sentences.chinese: 在瞄準遙遠目標的同時，不要輕視近處的東西。

sentences.english: Both are equally remote and vacuous.
sentences.chinese: 二者都同樣是遙遠和空虛的。

sentences.english: For the Old Kentucky Home far away.
sentences.chinese: 爲那遙遠的肯塔基故鄉。

definition: far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
in (some place)/to be in (adversity, a difficult situation, danger, turmoil etc)/to find oneself in/placed in/surrounded by
